metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5393 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The "mozAddonManager" allows for the installation of extensions from the CDN for addons.mozilla.org, a publicly accessible site. This could allow malicious extensions to install additional extensions from the CDN in combination with an XSS attack on Mozilla AMO sites. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 51.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5393` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 51.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 51.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 51.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 51.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '51.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
